about.title: About
about.description: Based in Agnes Water Australia, De Maine is a family developing unique boutique software and multi media for a miriad of sectors. Our clients have presented us with challenges that led us on a path to creating some truely unique software and digital experiences.
about.quote: Design is where science and art break even.
about.end: We firmly believe that software development is more than just a matter of technical ability. Our team  has an exclusive blend of creative and technical skills, allowing us to produce outstanding software solutions. We are fully committed to delivering inventive software that outshines the competition and fulfills all of our clients' demands. With our unparalleled combination of technical know-how and artistic finesse, we are eager to elevate your software project to the next level.

contact.title: Don't be shy!
contact.description: Like what we do? Have a project you want realised or maybe you need a developer to finish your project. We would love to hear from you.
contact.thankyou: Thank you, we will be in contact shortly.

projects.name: Zonify
projects.short: We App and delivery platform for Geolocation interactive information and learning kiosks
projects.description:
Zonify digital placemaking.

Augment your places with information, media and interactivity, while increasing your community's engagement with their physical space.

Zonify is a platform and a progressive web app that can be branded and modified through an administration app to display interactives and information at given geo locations. Click on the website link for a comprehensive product description.
projects.head: /assets/img/works/head-zonify.jpg

media.description: Zonify App Outside of a Zone

projects.name: Solid State
projects.short: OpenSource Platform for trading artwork as shares
projects.description: A decentralised market for trading shares in Artworks. The owner of a collection artwork/s maintains storage and security of the artwork, while allowing for the artwork to realise its investment value by allowing others to invest in it as parts/shares. These parts/shares are ec20 tokens. The platform is broken into 2 contracts. The Artwork contract and The Gallery contract. Each Artwork Contract manages its own buy and sell orders / trades. The price of the Artwork's shares adjusts the artworks price. Ultimately "the market" defines the price of the artwork.
projects.head: /assets/img/works/head-solidstate.png

projects.name: Luminous Light Festival 2021
projects.short: Audio Interactive and AI Based Projections
projects.description: Audio Interactive mapped projections and AI based Interactive mapped projections utilising Ar[t] and Map technologies for the Gladstone Regional Councils Luminous Light Festival.
projects.head: /assets/img/works/head-luminous-2021.jpg

projects.name: Luminous Light Festival 2019
projects.description: WE:\Triad at Luminous Light Festival Gladstone July 2019 is a digital projection installation the used Deep Learning Algorithms to categorise captured faces, into adult male, female and child. Caught faces are transformed into 3d meshes that are animated via mesh morphing and alpha blending. The public add their faces to WE via a tablet mounted on the temporary fencing to the left of the projections. Conceptually WE:\Triad navigates the premise that the triad of humanity, man, woman and child is an ancient entropy defeating organism.
projects.head: /assets/img/works/head-luminous-2019.jpg

projects.name: Ceramassist
projects.short: Web App for ceramic studio production management
projects.description:
A workflow and documentation suite for ceramic artists

Designed for Kaolin and Coal Ceramics.

Features include :
  • Sample / Material database, with location maps and seger formula.
  • Document database, ability to link documents to other sections.
  • Formula Database.
  • Recipes Database, with groups
  • line, triaxle, quadraxial blend tests
  • Firing database with firing schedule and kiln database
  • Ware database, a place to store ware.
  • Distribution, interconnect wordpress / woo commerce web store to the ware database, manage exhibitions and stock in retailers/galleries
projects.head: /assets/img/works/head-ceramassist.jpg

projects.name: AR[t]
projects.short: Framework for network driven interactives via web browsers
projects.description:
AR[t] is the back bone of our current digital interactive installation projects. The projects currently take the form of digital mapped projections, connectivity to deep learning for mapped projections, interactivity with digital projections through the use of network devices (Arduino/Raspberry Pi computers, mobile phones, tablets etc) and interactive in device 2d and 3d Augment Reality.

AR[t] distributes Augment Reality applications from one centralised scalable cloud server.

Base applications take the form of plugins that are run as instances. These instances can uniquely utilise users and roles. Each instance has its own settings delivered through a JSON settings file. For example an artwork application can have user log in to interact with each other or within a single instance of and artwork application.

The architecture of the cloud server has been developed with python3. Each instance is set up through a web based interface.

PLUGINS:
  • Mapper, a projection mapping system that enable, GLSL shader, images, videos, video streams, 3d content and JavaScript programs to be displayed on the light mapping. Mapper is used in my projects bMap, We and custom event light mapping for festivals and cultural events.
  • arZone, a in device augmented reality system, for displaying augmented reality content at specific GPS locations. ARzone is used in projects Storm Surge Totems and Wreck Point AR
  • Zone, a system for displaying 2d content at given GPS point. A zone can be used for information on walk, festivals,arts trails cities where information can be access about specific places and times. For example Zone can be used to display who playing currently at a particular venue at music festival or to display information at import geological or flora at specific points along a national park walking trail.
projects.head: /assets/img/works/head-artnet.jpg

projects.name: BMap
projects.description:
BMap was commissioned by the Livingstone Shire Council Smart Arts initiative in conjunction with Australian Federal Government. BMap is both an artwork and a learning tool for graphics programming with the GLSL openGL shader language. Its purpose is both for eye candy and to inspire creative graphics programming.

Physical installation hardware : NEC 8000 lumen 4k Projector, Nvidia Sheild TV computer.

Physical installation Software : Javascript / WebGL / GLSL standalone / WebKit app running on modified Android 9.

The bMap installation projects GLSL fragment shaders as animations onto UVmapped vertex geometry referred to as surfaces. To program graphics for bMap knowledge of GLSL Language is required.

The bMap Scene has multiple surfaces that parallel the physical projection planes (the ground, the tree trunks and the tree foliage). Once Logged into bMap you are presented with the main Screen. It is broken into 4 layers. From the top : menu, surface builder & preview, your shaders & other peopleâ€™s shaders.
projects.head: /assets/img/works/head-bmap.jpg

projects.name: Wreck Point AR
projects.short: Augmented Reality educational interactive for the Livingstone Shire Council
projects.description: Wreck Point is an educational interactive,  designed and developed for the Livingstone Shire Placemaking. This Augmented Reality work at Wreck Point Lookout Yeppoon is designed to educate the public about the geography, the ship wreck Selina and the native turtle species that are viewable from the lookout. This project is built on top of my software AR[t] utilizing the arZone plugin.
projects.head: /assets/img/works/head-wreckpoint.jpg
